Name: 0_controllability_functionalities_functionality_scenarios
Representative_Docs: ['if the identification of scenarios is not done before validation it should be done before the testing of controllability functionalities 9.2.1', 'controllability functionality is the description of controllability functionality used in scenario see 9.2.1', 'test the controllability functionalities within each scenario to determine the system input and output when controllability functionalities are used']

Name: 1_risk_knowledge_management_credit
Representative_Docs: ['this meaning of control in iso/iec tr is consistent to the use of control in this document ai risk management iso/iec uses the term control in the context of organization management meaning the ability of an organization to influence or restrict certain activities identified to be risk sources', 'iso and iec maintain terminology databases for use in standardization at the following addresses iso online browsing platform available at iec electropedia available at 3.1 ontology conceptualisation of domain source iso/iec 5392:2024 3.9 3.2 knowledge representation process that designs and constructs symbolic systems 3.9 rules frameworks or other methodologies used to express knowledge which machines can recognize and process source iso/iec 5392:2024 3.18 3.3 knowledge computing process that obtains new knowledge based on existing knowledge and their relationships source iso/iec 5392:2024 3.28 3.4 knowledge fusion process that merges combines and integrates knowledge from different resources into coherent form source iso/iec 5392:2024 3.21 3.5 control verb controllability in engineering the monitoring of system output to compare with expected output and taking corrective action when the actual output does not match the expected output source iso/iec/ieee 24765:2017 3.846.1 3.6 controller authorized human or another external agent that performs control note to entry controller interacts with the control points of an ai system', 'iso/iec emphasizes the interface of an ai system which enables the control by controller while the controllability defined in this document is more about the functionalities that allow for control ai system functional safety iso/iec tr uses the term control with two different meanings control risk this meaning refers to an iterative process of risk assessment and risk reduction']

Name: 2_resources_consumption_bandwidth_energy
Representative_Docs: ['when the system is in state other than one of the selected states the system can reach the required state by sequence of controls but resource consumption can be outside of acceptable limits', 'resource consumption several kinds of resources including time duration signal transmission bandwidth storage energy etc. can be consumed by control transfer process', 'resource consumption the control instructions via function invocations signal transmissions or physical operations can take time energy communication bandwidth storage space and any other resources needed']

Name: 3_validation_verification_documentation_controllability
Representative_Docs: ["table b.1 example template of the documentation for the validation output of an ai system 's controllability scenarios input output aspects controllability functionality type results of controllability functionality test environ- ment measures and values qualified to prevent from dropping and being damaged cleaning robot can enter state non-cleanable area detected and stops to move for- ward if descending staircase is detected robot is near to descend- ing staircase light on ro- bot body turns on indicating non-cleanable area is detected", "table a.1 example template of the documentation for the verification output of an ai system 's controllability requirement aspects controllability functionality type test environment input output measures and values qualified cleaning robot should be in ready for control after launched", 'annex informative example verification output documentation table a.1 is an example of the documentation for the verification output of an ai system controllability']

Name: 4_controllability_layers_functionality_design
Representative_Docs: ['at least the following two ways exist to realize the controllability of an ai system use the facilities designed and implemented for the purpose of control take advantage of the functional operations they are not specifically designed and implemented for control but can be used for the purpose of control', 'make use of controllability functionalities provided by layers of an ai system and avoid redundant encapsulation or re-implementation if applicable', 'controllability functionalities of an ai system are used through control points and controllability functionalities can be provided by certain layers e.g']

Name: 5_transition_condition_states_entering
Representative_Docs: ['5.3.3 process of system state transition once triggered system state transition can occur', 'two types of conditions can be considered for cause system state transition sufficient condition that by itself causes the transition to take place as long as the condition is met necessary condition that is required to be met for the state transition to take place', '5.3 system state transition 5.3.1 target of system state transition the system state transition target is finite subset of the system possible states which are acceptable by stakeholders according to set of requirements']

Name: 6_points_control_executes_starts
Representative_Docs: ['the ai system releases the control points in the span of control and starts to listen for other instructions from the controller', 'the controller declares the use of the required control points while the ai system releases those control points and then listens for and executes the instructions from the controller', 'control instruction execution for ai systems that execute control instructions from an authorized and authenticated controller the sequence of subprocesses that execute the control instructions should be controllable']

Name: 7_transfer_mechanism_transactional_transaction
Representative_Docs: ['to handle this transaction mechanism should be considered for control transfer which guarantees either the control transfer is entirely successfully performed or entirely not performed if partial failure happens', 'when control transfer involves multiple control points during an engagement or disengagement process partial success can happen if failed operations occur during an entire procedure', 'transactional mechanism should be also prepared for disengagement of control process where partial failure can happen during the relinquishment of multiple control points']

Name: 8_transfer_controller_control_prepare
Representative_Docs: ['figure transfer of control from an ai system to controller control transfer preparation process is conducted based on the requirements of the control', 'transfer of control can fail if either the controller or the ai system does not prepare well or is affected by unpredicted external factors', 'the following consequences can exist when control transfer takes place from an ai system to controller out of control state when transfer of control happens the ai system releases specific set of control points to the controller']

Name: 11_disengagement_engagement_control_uncertainty
Representative_Docs: ['6.7 disengagement of control the disengagement of control is process opposite to the engagement of control', 'the criteria of the engagement of control process can be selected and used in the context of control disengagement but with different meaning for each time duration limitation on the completion of disengagement of control physical space limitation allowed by an ai system for disengagement of control order restriction on the disengagement of control when multiple control points are relinquished authority restriction on the disengagement of control when security requirements exist on the relinquishment of control points completeness of disengagement over the entire span of the intended control', '3.7 disengagement of control control disengagement process where controller 3.6 releases set of control points 3.16 3.8 engagement of control control engagement process where controller 3.6 takes over set of control points 3.16 note to entry besides taking over set of control points an engagement of control can also include confirmation about the transfer of control to controller']

Name: 12_sequence_actions_diagram_criteria
Representative_Docs: ['figure control process activity diagram the process of control can involve both the controller and the ai system under control', 'figure use case diagram with examples of an ai system under control figure shows use case diagram as an example of an ai system under control for specific purpose of control controller can observe system states and issue control instructions to an ai system via span of control provided by that system', 'to control the ai system the engagement of control process should be prepared in advance to plan sequence of actions and satisfy the corresponding criteria']

Name: 13_testing_settings_functional_environment
Representative_Docs: ['9.1.4 non-functional testing for controllability non-functional testing includes the tests on performance efficiency security stability usability and any other aspects that can influence the execution of controllability functionality', 'test environment is the collection of environmental parameters and influences see 9.2.1 that can affect the controllability functionality', 'use test data and system configurations that cover not only the data and settings required by 9.1.1 but also data and settings based on real use']

Name: 14_cost_resources_spent_control
Representative_Docs: ['6.9.2 cost estimation for control the cost of control for the controller the ai system other entities and the environment should be estimated and checked including the following whether the magnitude of resources required by control exceeds the limits of the system', '6.10.2 cost estimation for control transfer the following should be checked when estimating the cost of control transfer whether the control transfer makes use of resources that are required by the system functioning whether the control transfer makes use of number of resources exceeding the system limits whether the control transfer can lead to an out of control state', 'once estimated the cost of control should be provided to the controller or intended stakeholders of an ai system who determines the acceptability of the cost see figure and take further actions regarding control of the ai system 6.10 cost of control transfer 6.10.1 consequences of control transfer the aim of estimating cost of control transfer is useful for determining the feasibility of an intended control transfer']

Name: 15_features_requirements_semantic_termination
Representative_Docs: ['7.2.1.4 requirements on semantic computing-based ai systems controllability for semantic computing-based ai systems requirements on controllability include the start and termination of reasoning process should be controllable', '7.2.2 requirements on controllability of continuous learning systems 7.2.2.1 ml-based continuous learning systems for machine learning-based continuous learning systems requirements for controllability include the start and termination of learning process shall be controllable', '7.2.1.3 requirements for ml-based ai systems controllability for machine learning-based ai systems requirements for controllability include the start and termination of an inference process shall be controllable']

Name: 17_controllers_multiple_component_collaborative
Representative_Docs: ['collaborative control can be involved in the following cases multi-controllable components and one controller an ai system contains multiple components e.g', 'robot controlled by multiple external human controllers contains component that can listen for and execute controllability instructions from multiple controllers', 'group of robots and controlled by multiple human controllers contains multiple components and each component can listen for controllability instructions from multiple controllers']

Name: 18_neural_deep_learning_networks
Representative_Docs: ['for ai systems using neural networks during backpropagation gradient values of relevant part of neural network should be observable', 'mathematic computations defined by deep learning neural network and computational logics semantically verifiable logic those subprocesses should be controllable such that the potential hazards caused by unpredicted behaviours can be intervened and restricted', 'the observations to the input and output values of the following should be enabled entire system module of the system specific neurons layers or structures of neural network for the systems where neural networks are used the observations to machine learning-based ai system execution logs and errors should be enabled']

Name: 19_policy_metal_decisions_learning
Representative_Docs: ['the inability to reverse side effects should be carefully considered when using ai systems in domains such as material processing and manufacturing', 'despite being used to enable systems to perform automated predictions recommendations or decisions ai systems have raised wide range of concerns', 'example an ai-based automated metal processing product line can be controlled via digital control subsystem as well as set of physical facilities on the production line']

Name: 20_span_controller_points_control
Representative_Docs: ['if the controller is not able to perform the intended control due to lack of span of control the controller requests control transfer', 'an incomplete span of control can lead to control transfer from the system to the controller that the controller can handle or operate all the control points of an intended control', 'if the controller does not hold all the control points for the required span of control the controller generates an additional control transfer request before its engagement of the control']

Name: 22_unsafe_stability_states_parameters
Representative_Docs: ['source iso 21717:2018 3.3 modified states as state 3.11 system state stability stable system state degree to which system parameters and observable characteristics remain invariable during specified period of time or another dimension such as space note to entry invariableness can be defined by means of variableness tolerance based on business requirements', 'note to entry when leaving stable system state the system parameters or observable characteristics change regardless of whether the next stable state is safe or unsafe when the system 3.9 enters an unstable system state', '3.12 safe state state 3.10 that does not have or lead to unwanted consequences or loss of control 3.13 unsafe state state 3.10 that is not safe state 3.12 note to entry uncertain states are subset of unsafe states']

Name: 24_digital_instructions_subsystem_temperatures
Representative_Docs: ['therefore before an actual control is performed the following should be confirmed that the system can accept and conduct the control instructions from specific controller', 'the controls of the system can be configured in advance and issued in real time via the digital control subsystem', 'to use the digital control subsystem and to enter the physical control area can require that the identification information of human controllers be checked']

Name: 25_controllability_human_describes_technical
Representative_Docs: ['controllability is technical prerequisite of human oversight of an ai system so that the human-machine interface can be technically feasible and enabled', 'vi technical specification information technology artificial intelligence controllability of automated artificial intelligence systems scope this document specifies basic framework with principles characteristics and approaches for the realization and enhancement for automated artificial intelligence ai systems controllability', 'when an ai system is in its operation and monitoring stage human can be in the loop of control deciding control logics and providing feedback to the system for further action ai system quality model iso/iec describes user controllability as sub-characteristic of usability']

Name: 26_safety_fault_technical_socio
Representative_Docs: ['constraints on the ai system socio-technical human procedural and technical components and their interactions and implement socio-technical controls to ensure they are not violated see for example systems theoretic accident model and process stamp systems theoretic process analysis stpa in reference', 'for safety-critical ai systems requirements should be identified before the system any software or hardware design is undertaken as it is usually not possible to retrofit safety design features', '8.3.6 safety-critical ai system design considerations the following can be in addition considered during the design of safety-critical ai system controllability use of independent safety systems and safeguards such as watchdog timers and hardware interlocks independent monitors or simple fail-safe systems real-time systems methods where deterministic timing or other deterministic behaviour is required fault management techniques in ai system architecture with primacy given to fault avoidance and fault removal followed by designing for detection and fault tolerance and communication to control agents such as humans or other monitoring systems for an overview of functional safety methods see iso/iec tr']
